headline: Bitcoin drops below $90,000 for the first time since April
summary: Bitcoin briefly fell below $90,000 overnight as investors sell once high-flying assets like cryptocurrencies and artificial intelligence stocks.  Bitcoin fell to around $89,500 early Tuesday, its first drop below $90,000 since April.  Shares of Robinhood Markets, which have tripled this year on the strength of crypto trading, are down 21% so far in November.

Shares of Robinhood Markets, which have tripled this year on the strength of crypto trading, are down 21% so far in November.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nvidia, Home Depot, Cloudflare, Coinbase, Honeywell, Medtronic, PDD, and More
summary: Stock futures were falling Tuesday as investors continued to dump risk assets, particularly artificial-intelligence stocks, amid fears the Federal Reserve won’t cut interest rates next month.  The stock has finished lower in three of the past five trading sessions and has fallen nearly 8% in November.  Home Depot  fell 3.9% after third-quarter adjusted earnings missed analysts’ estimates and the largest U.S. home-improvement retailer cut its full-year outlook.

headline: Coinbase, Klarna, Lockheed Martin: Trending stocks
summary: Coinbase (COIN) stock is dragged down by the broader selloff in crypto and bitcoin. Klarna (KLAR) posts its first earnings report since going public in New York. The owner of Arc'teryx, Salomon and Wilson (AS) continues to grow. Akzo Nobel (AKZA.AS) and Axalta (AXTA) agree to merge to form a global industrial coating giant. And Lockheed Martin (LMT) is in focus after Trump says he will approve the sale of F-35 fighter jets to Saudi Arabia. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Crypto can be volatile: Here's what investors need to know
summary: Coinbase (COIN) head of institutional strategy John D'Agostino and Benchmark Company managing director and senior research analyst of fintech and digital assets Mark Palmer join Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton to map out the volatility behind cryptocurrencies and explain why investors need to be patient with bitcoin (BTC-USD) in particular. Make sure to watch Yahoo Finance's interview with the full panel. For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.

headline: Asian shares sink, tracking a tech-led sell-off on Wall Street
summary: Asian shares tumbled on Tuesday, with benchmarks in Tokyo and Seoul sinking more than 3%, after Nvidia and other artificial-intelligence -related shares pulled U.S. stocks lower.  U.S. futures dropped, with the contract for the S&P 500 down 0.6% while the future for the Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 0.4%.  Computer chip giant Nvidia, at the center of the craze over AI, is due to report its earnings on Wednesday.

headline: Is Coinbase Still a Good Value After Its 17% Drop Amid Regulatory Shifts?
summary: Curious if Coinbase Global stock is a bargain, overpriced, or set for a comeback? You are not alone, and even experienced investors are digging into its value proposition right now. After skyrocketing an incredible 540.2% over the past 3 years, Coinbase shares have dropped sharply, falling 17.0% in the last week, 21.4% over the past month, and now sitting at just 2.6% higher for the year to date. This recent volatility follows a mix of industry news and shifting regulatory signals. Ongoing...

headline: Fear Engulfs Bitcoin Traders Betting on Free Fall to $80,000
summary: The world’s largest cryptocurrency plunged below $90,000 on Tuesday morning during Asia trading, deepening a selloff that’s erased all of its gains for the year.  In the options market, traders are making increasingly bearish wagers, on the conviction that the slide is far from over as deep-pocketed buyers beat a retreat.  After riding Bitcoin to the highs just weeks ago, traders have snapped up more than $740 million worth of contracts betting on continued declines expiring in late November — far outpacing interest in bullish positions.

headline: QQQ-SPX Volatility Spread Widens To 1Y High On Tech Angst
summary: Implied volatilities gained modestly across asset classes last week as the US government re-opened and anticipation built ahead of key economic data releases this week.
